intro: Brachystelma distinctum, commonly known as the distinct starling cactus, is a small, succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often strikingly beautiful flora. The plant features a short, cylindrical stem with sparse, white to pale green leaves that are often reduced to scales. Its flowering occurs in late winter to early spring, producing small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. Brachystelma distinctum is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its succulent stems and leaves to survive dry periods.
